Detailed Description

Date:
2009-04-24
Author:
Jean-Lou Dupont
Handles pooling / recycling of ``envelopes``

FOR MORE INFORMATION, CONSULT ``pool.h``

This module is thread-safe.

Definition in file pool.c.

Function Documentation

void __litm_pool_clean ( litm_envelope *  envlp  ) 

Cleans an ``envelope``

NOTE: use with care i.e. the ``msg`` member is just NULLed.

Definition at line 164 of file pool.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void __litm_pool_destroy ( litm_envelope *  envlp  ) 

Destroys an ``envelope`` ie. just use free()

A client of this module **must** dispose of the internal structure of the ``envelope`` (ie. the ``msg`` member) before using this function.

Definition at line 144 of file pool.c.

Here is the caller graph for this function:

litm_envelope* __litm_pool_get ( void   ) 

Retrieves an ``envelope`` from either:

  • the stack if one is available
  • the heap

Either case, the ``envelope`` is initialized before returning it to the client.

Definition at line 81 of file pool.c.

Here is the call graph for this function:

Here is the caller graph for this function:

void __litm_pool_recycle ( litm_envelope *  envlp  ) 

Recyles an ``envelope`` by either:

  • putting it on a stack for later recall
  • destroying it if there is no more place on the stack

NOTE: it is the responsibility of the client of this module to dispose of properly of the internal structure (ie. the ``msg`` member) of the ``envelope`` **before** using this recycling facility.
